Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: Francis M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever been in. From the view of concrete wall and reinforcing mesh, ( to keep victims in???), 4" from the window to the extremely dated and decrepit interior which makes my skin crawl thinking about it. Thought best to avoid breakfast. £50 per night might not be dear for London, but do they ever get repeat business?? Slept above the covers because I was terrified of what lurked beneath. What an advert for tourists who will assess Britain by what they are unfortunate to come across in places like this. Awful Awful Awful avoid like the plague!!

Reviews.Title: “never again..................”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: poor bathroom; door couldn't be closed using the toilet; no possibility to put off the heating, far too warm in the room; small room, no space to leave the luggage; shower was hard to regulate hot and cold; only the beds seemed ok. After trying breakfast one morning we did not take anymore and bought our own food; even the eggs and toast were awful............poor service and not enough space in the room for everyone to take breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel with no great expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Lorna1320
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel really was not good! We were shown to our room (at the very top of the hotel!) which was not ready so we had to wait outside it. Whilst there we noticed that the bannister was broken in a couple of places - mentioned this to the cleaner who said she knew and had told them - but that was it. On entry to the room we noticed that there was no handle or lock on the bathroom door, no was there any plug in the sink. The drawers were utter crap, nobs fell off, drawers stuck. Bed was the only thing that was nice - although the covers were blankets! Our shower leaked all over the floor and we had to use the two 'very small towels that we were given' to mop it up. There was no hand towel either! Mentioned to the manager that we needed new towels only to be told that 'there are only two provided (they were hand towels rather than bath towels!!!!) and when I explained that we needed two new ones - I was told 'whatever!' - totally unacceptable. That night the room was so hot we had to sleep with the windows OPEN - with not many blankets to keep us warm we eneded up sleeping with our coats on as we couldnt work out how to switch the heating off in our room! Breakfast in the morning was ANOTHER DISASTER! Jars of Jam, bowls of crap margerine and a container of orange juice were on the table greated us! Beans were COLD, scrambled egg was COLD and the fried eggs were LOOK-WARM. The heating plate for the food was broken. Cold plates too! Staff were attentive, but when I asked for hot beans I got look warm ones! Totally not acceptable. How do you know that bacteria has been erradicated if you are served COLD FOOD! We spent time out as much as possible! Bedsheets were clean so no sign of bed bugs - but I bet there were some! I really would recommend you NOT stay at this hotel with children as its really not up to scratch. For really cheap accommodation where you dont have to worry about good food in the morning or the state of the place generally - then by all means use this hotel, but we certainly wont be using the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDR444
Reviews.Content: With this place you get what you pay for. If you are after first class facilities and service, then give this place a miss. If you are after cheap accommodation in London, in a place that is relatively clean, then this may be a place for you. However, I do have to agree with previous reviewers and note that I did receive a few bites over the course of my stay. Possibly bed bugs??

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel , bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Omriki
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel very good food , bad rooms , good location

Reviews.Title: “terrible!”
Reviews.Author: H B
Reviews.Content: Don't go, there are bedbugs. 20+ stings in three nights, and there's the risk of bringing them back with you. The manager didn't seem to care. No soundproofing (we had the pleasure of getting woken up by our neighbours' conversation at 4 a.m.), decrepit windows overlooking a busy street (ambulance sirens all night), a huge gap under the door so hear everything happening in the corridors as well. Unreliable hot water, nominal finish and cleanliness of the bathroom fixtures. Not much choice for breakfast (eggs, beans, toast), only available from 7:30 to 9 am. You'll get kicked out at 9 on the dot. The only good point is that it's not too far from the tube. All that for a place that's not all that cheap. Don't go!

Reviews.Title: “This should not be allowed to be open”
Reviews.Author: Batti823
Reviews.Content: The room given was in the basement.Dirty room, unconfortable beds.Wiew of a full of rubbish court yard.Smell of humidity.Drops of water coming down from the toilet roof. Toilet dirty with mould everywhere. NO rail for towel.Only one switch for the light. wiring electric cables coming out the TV wall socket. Very noisy at night. Door was not secure.breakfast was fry eggs, beans and jam with some toasted bread. The two young women working in the kitchen never said hello, or god morning or anything , they just carry on chatting ignoring the costumers. Same was for the receptionist in the morning. He was lying down in a improvised bed, never said good morning when I give the keys back( he never got up from the bed were he was). Health and safety and Hygine should keep this hotel closed. ACtually at the main hall entrance the water was coming down from above our heads, just near the chandelier......Orrible place. I am sorry but people should know how bad this place is. How they managed to have the permission to open this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “im a regular”
Reviews.Author: steven1977
Reviews.Content: This is the second summer i stayed here. Very pleased with everything, clean and welcoming from staff. Happy to visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I WAS STOLEN AND EXTRA-CHARGED TOO”
Reviews.Author: michaelcom
Reviews.Content: Exactly the same story as Luli2011: stolen laptop + a few other things, (about $1000) I've got police report and hotel manager's report. And after that they write to booking.com about my 'not arriving' and some charging fee for one night!!!! Nightmare!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I WAS STOLEN IN THIS HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luli2011
Reviews.Content: 24 july 2011 When I came back at night, I have found out that an employee STOLE GOODS FROM MY LUGGAGE (goods value more than 300 dolars!!!!). Nobody took responsability and today I received a note that the hotel debited un amount of my credit card because they said I did not arrive. A NIGHTMARE !!! Please, take notice of that!!! First of all, I did reserve in the EURO HOTEL(31 Shepherds Bush Road) but when I did the check-in, the receptionist sent me ARBITRARILY to the BALKAN HOTEL (33 Shepherds Bush Road). They are both from the same owner, I knew it; but I decided to reserve in the Euro Hotel, as the reviews were a bitter more "positives". The Balkan Hotel has no reception, there is no control at all, and the lock doors are old. Although another room was stolen too, I am completely sure that the goods from my luggage were taken by an employee, and not a street thief, as they wanted me to believe. I saw the luggage carefully closed, for exemple. Both hotels are very insecure. Noone took responsability of the robbery. In addition to that, today I have received an email from booking.com that the hotel said that I did not arrive to the hotel. So, they debited un amount of money from my credit card!!!!! It is a nightmare! I cannot believe it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If not our worst choise then a close second”
Reviews.Author: m_m2500
Reviews.Content: First up, we did book this hotel by mistake.(wrong Euro Hotel). Good points, price and relatively easy to and from London central. On arrival staff member was helpful. Room looked cleanish and bed was comfortable (twin) Ok, now to the nitty gritty. Luke warm shower in the evening and cold in the morning. To use the toilet you can only sit with the door open as the bowl basically touches the door. You get to know your travelling partner much better. We were in London during "an English heat wave" yet we woke up to find the central heating on and woke up in the sweats. Very basic heigine used with breakfast, something akin to 3rd world standard. Tried to raise issues with duty manager on departure but was was met with indifference and a shrugg. For an extra 10 pound a night could have done much better.

Reviews.Title: “dirty toilets”
Reviews.Author: Ameen3012
Reviews.Content: room 6 of block 29 was my room.Heavily stained brownish black toilet.No towels.No soaps.very old floor paper about to peel off.very noisy whole, can hear the whole road shouting. Bed was okay. Atleast bed sheets were clean.Breakfast was average.I didnt read the reviews before booking because it was a last minute affair. Can never recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: nautar99
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my other half for a 2 night weekend. Staff was very helpful, they were able to help us out with anything we wanted and gave us usefull sightseeing tips. I was very pleased with the quality of the room (we stayed in room 6 on the first floor), especially the cleaniless, the room cleaned very well everyday. The room was on the smaller size than what we normally get around otuside the city, but knowing this was London, we did expect this. You cannot go wrong with paying Â£60 a night in a decent place which is not too far away from central london (Zone 2 on the travelday card). Though we didnt try the breakfast as we got up late after our late night outs, but will be staying over again the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably worse than the internet photos and reviews!!!”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite124
Reviews.Content: Ok, we wanted to stay in a cheap hotel. But that one was preposterous. We stayed in paris for 10 euros less and it was soooo much better. 1)took us to nearby hotel balkan (worse reviews than euro hotel in tripadvisor) 2)huge disappointment when you enter the room 3) MOUSETRAP IN COMMON VIEW IN ONE OF THE ROOMS 4)dirty linen 5)freezing cold upstairs room 6)door of room very unstable when closed, didn't lock on the inside, no feeling of safety 7)awful breakfast of beans, disgusting to look at omelet, eggs like rubber 8)particulalry disliked the receptionist, an indian guy with whom we had little understanding 9)thaought we had payed for the first night in advance but as it turned out we hadn't. they had taken the money and then put it back to the credit card. now how stupid can that be??anyway, the money thing caused us a lot of frustration 10)in the "reception room" there was a "table" of carton boxes piled up and a bed sheet on top. cool ah???? All in all, it was a veeery bad choice that spoiled our generally beautiful holiday. Keep in mind that we were totally aware that we asked for a cheap hotel but that was too much. Are perhaps the positive comments of this site false? a propaganda of the hotel owner and staff?? i don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: alistairalistair
Reviews.Content: Just don't! We arrived and waited half an hour as our rooms were checked. Then we were taken to our rooms - in another 'hotel' 5 minutes walk away! The quad room had a double and a 3/4 bed in. Unfortunately, the room only fit them and little else, and our stroller couldn't get in enough to shut the door. The breakfast was terrible, with savers 'butter' in knifed into a bowl, savers OJ, tepid water in a big metal vat to make tea, and milk that tasted somewhat chemically/metallic. My father-in-law said it was what it tasted like when boiled for a while then allowed to cool, but I'm not sure that was all it was. They cut costs by only providing one mostly used roll of toilet paper, and not enough shampoo sachets for daily showers, a TV that didn't work in my in-laws room and only showed a snowy BBC 1&2 and ITV. Your knees hit the basin when sitting on the toilet. Our shower didn't start when you turned the water on, you had to alternate on off on off and the temperature low to high for several minutes then it would just start for no reason. With all this money saving, I couldn't understand why it was so hot. We had our radiator off in both rooms, but were cooking all night with the windows open (on an ambulance route too, so not much sleep). I've stayed in worse. Places where I felt less safe. Less clean (just). But for the price they were charging, it was truly awful. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: l0rna84
Reviews.Content: After an unfriendly and quite hostile welcome from staff we were pointed in the direction of a dark dank basement and told this was our room for the night. The room was filthy! At 4am we were awoken by the fire alarm, other guests were poking their heads out of the doors but no one seemed to be doing a lot. As we were in the basement we felt it best to go upstairs to investigate. There I found a fire alarm with water flowing out of it, with no staff present another guest out his room bin under the alarm to catch the water. If all this wasnâ€™t bad enough, breakfast consisted of cold beans, rubber toast and a fried egg which greatly resembled one of those childrenâ€™s Haribo sweet fried eggs. A TRUELY UNPLEASENT STAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: kevski82
Reviews.Content: Plus points: Service was OK. Good location. Nice toilets. Negatives: The hotel smells of wet dog. I am not kidding. When you can't open the bathroom door because the TV (sat on top of a fridge) is in the way you know the room is too small. Expensive for what you get. I've stayed in nicer youth hostels for a tenth of the price. Breakfast was very poor. Cooked breakfast is OK as long as you like baked beans, eggs and toast. And don't want them cold.

Reviews.Title: “The basement room - pretty grim”
Reviews.Author: brandaNMA
Reviews.Content: I got the basement room others have commented on. At least I think I did - I was taken several doors down from the actual hotel and then into what was pretty much a damp cellar with a bed in it. Several other things were sharing the bed with me which were obviously quite hungry. Judging by the reviews, there must be some better rooms somewhere else. But this was pretty grim.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely horrible, save your money & go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: wingthetraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, the staff of this hotel does not comprehend the word â€œserviceâ€�. The staff was rude and unprofessional when confronted relevant problems such as; no warm water in the morning, leakage, mice and no television. The staff drums up excuses as to why these problems exist, ranging from the hotel is full therefore there is no warm water or there are no engineers available during this time of the day to look at the leakage problem whilst the staff was made aware of this problem at the beginning of a working day. While explaining the problem at hand, staff member of the hotel dismisses the problem as of its not relevant and also blamed us (the guests) that we are not satisfied and that we have too high expectations. Is it too much to ask for a bed where you donâ€™t feel every single spring? Or warm water in the morning? Or as a matter of fact no mice? As a group we didnâ€™t expect much we accepted the fact that the beds were not comfortable, we even accepted the fact that there was no warm water however leakage right above a working lamp and mice? That is going a bit too far!

Reviews.Title: “Better off sleeping on the street!”
Reviews.Author: Jimm65
Reviews.Content: Awful place - avoid at all costs. The staff are probably the most unfriendly people I've ever met in my life. However the biggest joke is their attempt at a breakfast - a sort of do-it-yourself set up. I feel like I'm flattering the place by giving it one star!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're staying for couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: gabyte
Reviews.Content: We were staying there for 2 nights and I have to say that it was better than I expected. After reading many negatives reviews it was a really good sight. We arrived at the hotel at 11 pm, but the reception was working and we got a room on the 2 floor. The minus was that the stairs were really steep so it was hard to climb with the luggage. The room was really clean thou small. The bathroom was like a cupboard, you couldn't even close the door while using the toilet ;D LOL but that was not a problem for us. Breakfast were minimal but ok (eggs, beans, yoghurt, juice, toster...) The second night we had some problems sleeping because of the noise. The walls are paper thin and it seemed like there was a clogged tube on the other side. Moreover, the location is very good, as it is about 5 minute walk from a tube station. All in all if I had to stay in London for a few nights I would come to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: trottingtiger
Reviews.Content: Basement room. Smelt fusty. No wardrobe, TV did not work. Annoying red 'on light' on smoke detector flashed all night. Sound of a mouse gnawning behind paneling. Do-it-yourself breakfast with basic food. Walk from station at night in hostile area. Glad to leave. Never again will I stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the stay was very nice”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyf
Reviews.Content: i came here to attend a martial arts course down the road, and wanted a nice clean hotel. This hotel went way above my expectations and very happy to recommend it to everyone. it felt like home and would stay here again. Tiffany

Reviews.Title: “Great value with breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: cheesytraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an interview in Hammersmith and for that the location was ideal. It might be a bit further out for the main attractions of London but with good connections to the tube it's great! I got a nice big room for just me and it had a nice clean toilet and shower. The room was clean and, although a bit cold at first, nice and warm once you get the heating on, even had a fridge. Breakfast was good for what you pay, just a small buffet selection but it was good. Oh and free wi-fi is always a bonus! You're not going to get better value really within Central London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: xSunSeaSandx
Reviews.Content: Me my boyfriend and 2 of our friends stayed here on Friday 26th March after seeing Nol Gallagher at the Royal Albert Hall. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and we had a nice front view room (i requested this). The tube was around a 10 min walk away and there were plenty of shops nearby. The heating was on full blast so it was like a sauna but apart from that! overall it was great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Damp, Mildew, Freezing”
Reviews.Author: duffle55
Reviews.Content: I was given a bedroom in the basement of the 'annex' . The en-suite was full of black mildew- the whole ceiling covered in it and part of the walls. The shower-head was covered in black mildew gunge, as where the bottom edges of the shower cubicle. The mildew continued into the bedroom, which smelt damp and musty. The bedroom window opened out wide, but would not close completely, leaving the room vulnerable to burglary and leaving it freezing. I was also scared, as I was a lone female guest. I asked for the window to be made safe but despite a promise this was not attended to. I tried to tuck the curtain in to cover the open gaps but to no avail. The bed had only a sheet and one blanket. There was a radiator, which did not work, so I spent the night fully dressed and with my coat on, trying to sleep- which was near impossible. I was freezing. I left as soon as possible, not even staying for breakfast, as god only knows what the kitchen must be like! I complained to the Receptionist who was less than helpful, only saying he would check out my complaints. DON'T BOOK THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheep and Tatty Is What You Get.”
Reviews.Author: ronsomerset
Reviews.Content: We travelled to London for a weekend theatre show and some sightseeing and chose this hotel as it was close to Hammersmith Bus and Tube station. We booked a 3 bed room and a double. The double was in the basement with very limited room to walk one side of the bed. Room was tiny with a very small ensuite. Room was cold and only one towel supplied, no toilet roll only one cup etc on arrival. These items were sorted out by visiting the reception in the block next door. The 3 bedded room on the top floor was stifling, the radiator would not turn off and we had to spend the first night with all windows open - on Shepherds Bush Road??? It was not a peaceful night. Again towels etc were only provided for two people and a visit had to be made to reception next door. The banister rail had been pulled off and was at the bottom of the stairs, stair carpet was very lose fitting and dangerous. You could just about get into the ensuite and shut the door which wouldn't lock. No plug for the washbasin and the shower head wall fitting was missing. Breakfast was a laugh!! Carton of Tesco orange juice and a roll of kitchen paper towel on each table when you could find an empty one. Toast was deposited into a bread bin for self service along with warm scrambled egg, fried eggs and cold baked beans all left uncovered on a warming tray. After waiting for a table to be cleared and helping ourselves we asked for brown toast only to be told breakfast finished!! The same response was given to anyone entering or asking for anything after 09.00. The hotel was an experience we do not wish to repeat but we will dine out on the stories for a long time. We also made sure it did not spoil our weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Quite acceptable, though as basic as you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: Sinead F
Reviews.Content: Euro Hotel is nothing more than you would expect, though I have encountered worse for the price (35 pounds per night at the time; pretty affordable for London.) Positives: Bedroom clean and spacious enough; kind of narrow though also quite long. The bathroom was surprisingly modern and very clean. Free wifi was good; it dropped out a few times but not enough to be annoying and was fast enough when it worked. The staff were personable enough, and the hotel had a reasonably pleasant ambiance, especially the breakfast room. Negatives: You don't expect everything to work in a place like this and it didn't. The TV reception was very poor on most stations and I seem to recall Pay TV being advertised for free too though saw no evidence of this. And scrambled/poached eggs was the full extent of your 'cooked breakfast' (i.e., no bacon or sausages, meaning you have to load up on cold baked beans if you dare). Summary: I would stay here again if I could get the room for the same price, which I guess constitutes an overall thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “generally happy”
Reviews.Author: indochi
Reviews.Content: we came to the asian exhibiton at the olympia and needed something close, so booked this place, was generally happy with the place, was close and clean, and good for the price i paid, will recommend anyone,wifi toom some time to work though....

Reviews.Title: “Stay with care”
Reviews.Author: Greenhoppers
Reviews.Content: The Euro Hotel is cheap, cheerful and clean if all you want is a bed for the night although on arrival you could be despatched to 3 or 4 different hotels nearby. You will not get any idea of the room you are to be allocated until you get there. It could be massive or a broom cupboard. Book it through an agency NOT directly with the hotel (So you pay the agency). The hotel took my credit card details to confirm a booking. I told them on arrival I would pay cash and did not expect a claim against my credit card. I paid cash. When my credit card bill came ... guess what? ... I'm still trying to sort out this weeks later and no one at the hotel will speak to me or ring me back when I leave a message. My best advice? Pay another Â£20 per night and stay somewhere else. I will be be in future.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: michelle3t
Reviews.Content: well i came to a concert down the road at hammersmith apollo with my boyfriend. Got a room in Earls Court before i found out that there were hotels close to Hammersmith Apollo aswell, so got it cancelled and had a peak at hotels in Hammersmith, I must say from the price i paid for the hotel and what we got i was pretty happy. THe check in was pretty simple and quick and we got a room in mins, was kind of small but wasnt expecting 2 big a room in London. Room was spotless and had shower and toilet in it, plus had all the very basic facilities like tea and coffee and few sky channels, Overall i was Very Happy with the price that i paid for this hotel and had a brilliant experience, wont mind havin a different breakfast menu everyday, But very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Valbear
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site we weren't really sure what to expect, but I have to say we were all pleasently surprised. We were quite a large group of 24 people attending the Blind Crickt cup final, so there were several guide dogs too. The staff were friendly and check in was seamless with no fuss about the dogs either. Some of the rooms were small, but they were clean and tidy which is what really counts. I didn't find the single glazing or bedding an issue. The hotel is in a really good location with a great pub just down the road and lots of places to eat. Our check out was a bit complicated as we needed two recepts to claim some of our costs back, but this was no trouble for them at all and they couldn't have been more helpful. I'd recommend this hotel and will be staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god!!! never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: gemd3408
Reviews.Content: Well..... nightmare weekend all in all!!! there were a large group of us (8 in total, 4 couples) decided to book tickets for Jimmy Carr at the Hammersmith Appolo as we come from derby we thought we might as well make a weekend of it. We looked around on the internet for a suitable hotel, as my dad used to live in London he said Earl's Court was a good place to stay, good night life, so we booked the Cromwell Crown Hotel Â£110 for 2 nights, GREAT we thought! Booked this around May time, end of November get a phone call to say we have been moved to the Royal Guest House, wern't too fussed as long as we had a room!! Phoned the Royal Guest house at the start of the week, they had never heard of us GREAT!! well we sorted this out so was all fine!! Arrived at the hotel about 5 ish LOTS and LOTS of confusion!! Eventually sorted it all out and paid, were told by Cromwell Crown this hotel had agreed to do us a discounted price for the inconvinience, never happened!! but just wanted a large drink so just got o with it!!! anway after paying were told we would be in 2 different buildings, just grin and bear it, 2 couples were going to a newly refurbished hotel, and me and my partner and another couple to one yet to be done!! but we were told if we met at 9.30am at the original hotel we could move to the better hotel for the 2nd night!! So we got to our room and I could have cried!! *Single glazed windows no quilt just 2 sheets!!! *we had paid 55 for a double en suite we had a shower but it looked more like a tardis in the corner, scummy dirty and no proper ventilation, top had been turned at an angle to let air out!! * sink had been patched up with something that looked like chewing gum!! * NO TOILET.... EN SUITE?!?!?! *2 tv remoted neither worked!! * NO tea cofee or kettle * GENERLLY DISGUSTING!! met at 9.30 am only to be told no rooms till 11!!! GRRRRRR eventually after a nice day out returned at 5 to have nice rooms in Euro hotel, clean andcomfy not massive but vast improvment!!! so no toilet roll but we coped!! everything was ok nice sleep till 7am when we were awoken by someone hovering the hallway and banging the hoover on our door!! GREAT!! tried to go back to sleep ten mins later BANG BANG great we couldnt have been closer to the heavy handed staff in the kitchen then 15 mins later they were moving the room around next door and trying to fix a broken door!! eventually at 8.40 i couldnt cope anymore, got up for a shower !! NO HOT WATER!! packed my bags and left!! lets not even go into breakfast!! :) ALL IN ALL NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience for Great Price”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGirls
Reviews.Content: Eurohotel Guest House is a great place to stay for a good price. We were logging here for a couple days before we had to be moved to their other hotel chain (Royal Guest House 2), because of lack of space. I believe breakfast is included in the price. The breakfast consist of cereal, 2 toasts, choice of eggs (scrambled, or sunny side), side of beans, instant coffee, orange juice and/or tea. The hotel itself is located 3 - 5 minute walk from Shepherd's Bush Station. Surrounding the hotel there are little shops and restaurants. However I would suggest to get the 'Oyster card' for zone 1-2 for the underground transit*. Hotel Room is cosy, aka just enough space for your luggage (floor space) and the bed. The washroom are clean, but not pristine. I thought it felt more like a very good quality backpackers hostel then a hotel. In a hotel they don't relocate your room for any reason, as for a hostel if the room you are staying is needed then re-location takes place. The host at the Eurohotel is very nice and understanding, we definitely missed his jokes and kindness. We have also stayed at the Royal Guest House 2, please check it out, just in case you get relocated there. *A little note for first time buyers it cost 24pounds for a week pass, including the charge of the card. However, if you are just staying for a few days it is ideal just to buy the 'Oyster Card' on its own and put money in it. The card cost 3pounds and within Zone 1 & 2 the maximum cost of travel is 4.40pounds, where one trip can cost up to 1.80pounds. So even you use the card multiple times during the day it will only cost at most 4.40pounds.

HotelInfo.Name: Euro Hotel Hammersmith
HotelInfo.Address: 31 Shepherds Bush Road, London W6 7LX, England
